metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Incorporates new SP 800-53 Rev 5 controls where they genuinely improve coverage. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Security management system
clauses.rationale: PM-01 security program; PM-02 roles; PM-03 resources; PM-09 risk strategy. PL-09 (new in Rev 5) central management of security controls supports unified administration applicable to IACS security management.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 requires IACS-specific security management system integrated with safety management. SP 800-53 covers information security management; PL-09 improves central control but OT/ICS-specific integration with safety management is not addressed.

clauses.title: Security risk assessment
clauses.rationale: RA family covers risk assessment comprehensively. RA-07 (new in Rev 5) risk response adds explicit treatment actions; RA-09 (new in Rev 5) criticality analysis supports identification of critical IACS components for risk prioritisation.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 requires OT-specific risk assessment considering safety impacts, zone/conduit models, and SIL/SL targets. RA-07/RA-09 improve risk response and criticality but ICS/OT-specific risk methodology gaps remain.

clauses.title: Addressing risk with the security management system
clauses.rationale: PM-09 risk management strategy; CA-05 POA&M; RA-03 risk assessment. RA-07 (new in Rev 5) risk response provides structured risk treatment actions applicable to IACS risk management.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 risk treatment includes safety impact analysis and OT-specific countermeasures. RA-07 improves risk response but OT safety integration is absent.

clauses.title: Human user identification and authentication
clauses.rationale: IA-02 identification and authentication; IA-05 authenticator management; IA-08 non-organizational users.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 addresses ICS-specific authentication (operator stations, HMI). SP 800-53 covers authentication generally.

clauses.title: Software process and device identification and authentication
clauses.rationale: IA-03 device identification; IA-09 service identification.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 addresses ICS device authentication (PLCs, RTUs, IEDs). SP 800-53 covers device authentication but ICS protocol-specific authentication (e.g., Modbus, DNP3) not addressed.

clauses.title: Account management
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account management; AC-05 separation of duties; AC-06 least privilege.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap for this requirement.

clauses.title: Authenticator management
clauses.rationale: IA-05 authenticator management with password enhancements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 considers ICS constraints (shared accounts in control rooms, emergency access). SP 800-53 doesn't address operational technology authentication constraints.

clauses.title: Strength of password-based authentication
clauses.rationale: IA-05(1) directly covers password strength requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Authorization enforcement
clauses.rationale: AC-03 access enforcement; AC-04 information flow; AC-06 least privilege.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Mobile code
clauses.rationale: SC-18 mobile code restrictions.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 addresses mobile code in ICS context (ActiveX on HMI stations).

clauses.title: Auditable events
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-03 content of audit records; AU-12 audit generation.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 specifies ICS-relevant audit events (setpoint changes, mode changes, safety system activation). SP 800-53 covers audit generally.

clauses.title: Audit storage capacity
clauses.rationale: AU-04 audit log storage capacity; AU-05 response to audit processing failures.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Timestamps
clauses.rationale: AU-08 time stamps and synchronization. SC-45 (new in Rev 5) system time synchronization provides explicit controls for time source accuracy and integrity, important for ICS event correlation and sequence-of-events recording.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 considers ICS time synchronization (IEC 61850, PTP). SC-45 improves general time synchronization but ICS-specific protocols not addressed.

clauses.title: Communication integrity
clauses.rationale: SC-08 transmission integrity; SI-07 software/firmware integrity. CM-14 (new in Rev 5) signed components ensures cryptographic integrity verification of deployed components, relevant to firmware and configuration integrity in ICS.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 addresses ICS communication integrity (process variable integrity). CM-14 strengthens component integrity verification.

clauses.title: Software and information integrity
clauses.rationale: SI-07 software and firmware integrity verification; SI-07(1) integrity checks. CM-14 (new in Rev 5) signed components adds cryptographic component verification; SI-16 (new in Rev 5) memory protection prevents unauthorized code execution, relevant to PLC/RTU firmware integrity.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 addresses ICS firmware/software integrity (PLC programs, configuration files). CM-14/SI-16 improve integrity verification and memory protection.

clauses.title: Input validation
clauses.rationale: SI-10 information input validation.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 addresses ICS-specific input validation (engineering workstation inputs, setpoint ranges).

clauses.title: Information confidentiality
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection of information at rest; SC-08 transmission confidentiality; AC-03 access enforcement.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 considers ICS-specific confidentiality (process recipes, control algorithms).

clauses.title: Network segmentation
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SC-32 system partitioning; AC-04 information flow. SC-46 (new in Rev 5) cross-domain policy enforcement strengthens segmentation governance across IT/OT boundary zones.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 uses zones and conduits model for ICS network segmentation. SC-46 improves cross-domain policy enforcement but ICS-specific zone/conduit architecture not addressed.

clauses.title: Zone boundary protection
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection with enhancements. SC-46 (new in Rev 5) cross-domain policy enforcement supports zone boundary governance between IT and OT domains.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 zone boundaries include ICS-specific considerations (data historians, DMZ between IT/OT). SC-46 improves cross-domain enforcement but ICS DMZ architecture not specifically addressed.

clauses.title: Audit log accessibility
clauses.rationale: AU-09 protection of audit information; AU-06 audit review, analysis and reporting.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 considers ICS audit log access from safety perspective.

clauses.title: Continuous monitoring
clauses.rationale: CA-07 continuous monitoring; SI-04 system monitoring. SC-48 (new in Rev 5) sensor relocation supports adaptable monitoring positioning relevant to ICS network monitoring deployment.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 addresses ICS-specific monitoring (process variable anomalies, protocol anomalies). SC-48 improves monitoring adaptability but ICS protocol monitoring (Modbus/DNP3 deep packet inspection) not addressed.

clauses.title: Denial of service protection
clauses.rationale: SC-05 denial-of-service protection. SC-24 (new in Rev 5) fail in known state ensures systems default to a known-secure state upon failure, partially addressing ICS availability requirements.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 addresses availability of safety functions and deterministic operation. SC-24 provides fail-safe state concepts but safety function availability priority and real-time determinism not addressed.

clauses.title: Resource management
clauses.rationale: AU-04 storage capacity; SC-05 availability; CP-02 contingency planning. SC-06 resource availability already in Rev 5 provides resource priority allocation relevant to ICS real-time resource management.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 addresses ICS resource management for deterministic real-time operation. SP 800-53 doesn't address real-time operational constraints or process-priority scheduling.

clauses.title: Control system backup
clauses.rationale: CP-09 system backup; CP-06 alternate storage; CP-10 recovery and reconstitution.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 addresses ICS-specific backup (PLC programs, HMI configurations, historian data). SP 800-53 covers backup generally but ICS-specific backup requirements not detailed.

clauses.title: Control system recovery and reconstitution
clauses.rationale: CP-10 system recovery; IR-04 incident handling. SC-24 (new in Rev 5) fail in known state supports safe-state recovery concepts for control systems.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 addresses safe-state recovery and graceful degradation for control systems. SC-24 provides fail-safe state concepts but ICS graceful degradation and process safety recovery not fully addressed.

clauses.title: Network and security configuration settings
clauses.rationale: CM-02 baselines; CM-06 settings; CM-07 least functionality. PL-10 (new in Rev 5) baseline selection and PL-11 (new in Rev 5) baseline tailoring support structured approach to ICS configuration baseline management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: IEC 62443 addresses ICS-specific configuration (PLC hardening, SCADA server configuration). PL-10/PL-11 improve baseline governance.

clauses.title: Least functionality
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality.
clauses.gaps: IEC 62443 applies least functionality to ICS components (disable unused protocols on PLCs, remove unnecessary services on SCADA servers). SP 800-53 covers generally but ICS-specific protocol considerations not detailed.
